articles.title: Kalshi Abandons Its Affiliate Badges on Twitter
articles.summary: Kalshi quietly removed the affiliate badges from its Twitter influencers' profiles, ending its public display of paid partnerships. The move signals either a strategic shift away from influencer marketing or regulatory concerns about transparency in prediction market promotion.

articles.title: Which crypto company will ZachXBT expose for insider trading?
articles.summary: ZachXBT, crypto's most feared on-chain detective, has someone in his crosshairs for insider trading, and the betting markets are trying to guess which company gets exposed next. Smart money should watch for volume spikes in tokens connected to his targets, since his investigations typically crater prices within hours of publication.

articles.title: The Early Line: Utah Doesn't Love Prediction Markets
articles.summary: Utah's legislature is moving to ban or heavily restrict prediction markets, bucking the national trend toward legalization. The crackdown could signal broader regulatory backlash just as the industry gains mainstream acceptance, potentially spooking other conservative states eyeing similar bans.

articles.title: What Prediction Markets are Saying About a Fed Decision in March
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing in the Fed's next interest rate move at their March meeting, with traders betting on whether Powell and company will cut, hold, or surprise everyone. Rate decisions drive massive volatility across every asset class, making this one of the highest-stakes bets you can place on monetary policy.

articles.title: How Prediction Markets Polymarket and Kalshi Are Gamifying Truth
articles.summary: Polymarket and Kalshi are turning the search for truth into a game-like experience, complete with leaderboards, social features, and dopamine hits that keep users coming back to bet on real-world outcomes. This gamification could be the key to attracting mainstream users who wouldn't normally touch prediction markets, potentially unlocking the liquidity and participation these platforms need to become genuinely predictive rather than niche betting parlors.

articles.title: Prediction markets: What they are and why they matter
articles.summary: Prediction markets let you bet real money on everything from elections to corporate earnings, turning collective wisdom into hard price signals. They're becoming the go-to tool for cutting through noise and hype because people with skin in the game make better forecasts than pundits with nothing to lose.

articles.title: People are already putting money on SOTU. See prediction market odds
articles.summary: Traders are placing bets on State of the Union outcomes before Biden even steps to the podium, with markets offering odds on everything from speech length to specific policy mentions. This shows how prediction markets are expanding beyond elections into real-time political theater, creating new opportunities for bettors who can read between the lines of presidential rhetoric.

articles.title: Prediction Markets Are 95% Sure Nvidia Will Beat Earnings -- Here's What That Means for Investors
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing in a 95% chance that Nvidia will exceed Wall Street's earnings expectations when it reports results. This near-certainty creates a high bar for the stock to move meaningfully higher, since beating estimates is already baked into both prediction odds and likely the share price itself.

articles.title: $10 Kalshi Code SILIVE upgraded for NBA and NCAAB this month
articles.summary: Kalshi boosted its promotional code SILIVE from whatever it was before to $10 for new users betting on NBA and college basketball this month. The timing signals Kalshi wants to grab market share during peak basketball season when casual bettors flood prediction markets with March Madness and NBA playoffs approaching.

articles.title: Is Kalshi Likely to IPO in 2026?
articles.summary: Kalshi, the CFTC-regulated prediction market that's been rapidly expanding since launching in 2021, is eyeing a potential public offering within the next two years. An IPO would signal mainstream legitimacy for prediction markets and could unlock massive capital for Kalshi to compete with offshore giants like Polymarket.

articles.title: Kalshi’s Tarek Mansour on Prediction Markets, Regulation, and the Future of Truth in Finance
articles.summary: Kalshi CEO Tarek Mansour sat down to discuss how prediction markets are reshaping finance, the regulatory battles his company faces, and whether betting on real-world events can actually make information more accurate. His take matters because Kalshi is the only CFTC-regulated prediction market in the US, meaning his regulatory wins and losses directly determine what Americans can legally bet on.

articles.title: Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin Warns Prediction Markets Are On Path To Becoming 'Corposlop'
articles.summary: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin thinks prediction markets are heading toward becoming sanitized corporate garbage that strips away their edge and authenticity. If he's right, we're watching the slow death of the wild west betting atmosphere that made these platforms actually useful for price discovery and real insights.
